abstract: At a recent reading in Manhattan by David Sedaris, a reader presented his electronic-book device for the author to sign.
snippet: At a recent reading in Manhattan by David Sedaris, a reader presented his electronic-book device for the author to sign.
lead_paragraph: At book events, bibliophiles typically wait in line to present books to pen-wielding authors, but as readers increasingly turn to electronic-book devices like the Kindle, it raises the question of whether book-signings may one day go the way of the inkwell.

headline.main: Kindle Joins a Literary Ritual: Authors Can Autograph It
headline.print_headline: Kindle Joins a Literary Ritual: Authors Can Autograph It
